{{also|扛龟}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=扛龟}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ja|zh}} {{ja-l|スカンク}}, from {{etyl|en|zh}} {{m|en|skunk}}. First used in {{etyl|nan|cmn}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=kángguī
|mn=kòng-ku
|cat=v
}}

===Verb===
{{zh-verb}}

# {{lb|zh|chiefly|Min Nan}} to end up with nothing; to end up with no monetary reward

===Usage notes===
* Often used to describe situations where a lottery payout goes unclaimed. The Min Nan pronunciation is frequently used when reading aloud or speaking with others.
